summary: This is a March 10, 2020 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case against Tova Noel and Michael Thomas. It responds to discovery requests, providing details about surveillance video files from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and the defendants' activities on August 9-10, 2019, the period around Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein's Last Documented Movements
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was captured on MCC surveillance leaving his cell to make a phone call and later being escorted back to his cell on the evening of August 9, 2019.

events.title: Defendants' Computer Use
events.description: Defendants Noel and Thomas were using computers at their desk in the MCC, as shown by forensic examination and corresponding surveillance video.

events.description: Surveillance video from the early hours of August 10, 2019, captures the defendants at their desk and other activity in the Special Housing Unit.

keyFacts: The document is a discovery response in the criminal case against MCC correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas (No. 19 Cr. 830).
It provides specific MCC surveillance video file names and timestamps for August 9-10, 2019, detailing Jeffrey Epstein's movements and the defendants' activities.
The Government notes it has not reviewed all surveillance of Epstein from his over 30 days at the MCC but provides specific clips as a courtesy.
A redacted MCC technician's name is referenced (denoted as 'XX' in the text) in response to a discovery request.
The letter references forensic examination of the computers used by defendants Noel and Thomas during the critical period.
